description: Returns communications and attachments for one or more support cases. Use the afterTime and beforeTime parameters to filter by date. You can use the caseId parameter to restrict the results to a specific case. Case data is available for 12 months after creation. If a case was created more than 12 months ago, a request for data might cause an error. You can use the maxResults and nextToken parameters to control the pagination of the results. Set maxResults to the number of cases that you want to display on each page, and use nextToken to specify the resumption of pagination.

parameters.name: caseId
parameters.description: The support case ID requested or returned in the call. The case ID is an alphanumeric string formatted as shown in this example: case-12345678910-2013-c4c1d2bf33c5cf47

nested_items.name: caseId
nested_items.description: The support case ID requested or returned in the call. The case ID is an alphanumeric string formatted as shown in this example: case-12345678910-2013-c4c1d2bf33c5cf47

nested_items.name: body
nested_items.description: The text of the communication between the customer and Amazon Web Services Support.

nested_items.name: submittedBy
nested_items.description: The identity of the account that submitted, or responded to, the support case. Customer entries include the IAM role as well as the email address (for example, 'AdminRole (Role) <janedoe@example.com>). Entries from the Amazon Web Services Support team display 'Amazon Web Services,' and don't show an email address.

nested_items.name: timeCreated
nested_items.description: The time the communication was created.

nested_items.name: attachmentSet
nested_items.description: Information about the attachments to the case communication.

nested_items.name: fileName
nested_items.description: The file name of the attachment.
